017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.AbstractSet;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Set;
028import java.util.Spliterator;
029import java.util.Spliterators;
030
031import java.util.function.Predicate;
032
033import java.util.stream.Stream;
034
035import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
036
037import static java.util.Spliterator.DISTINCT;
038import static java.util.Spliterator.IMMUTABLE;
039import static java.util.Spliterator.NONNULL;
040import static java.util.Spliterator.ORDERED;
041import static java.util.Spliterator.SIZED;
042import static java.util.Spliterator.SUBSIZED;
043
044/**
045 * An immutable {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type}s that ensures that
046 * {@link Type} implementations from different vendors use the same
047 * equality semantics.
048 *
049 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
050 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
051 */
052public final class JavaTypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
053
054
055  /*
056   * Instance fields.
057   */
058
059
060  private final Set<? extends JavaType> set;
061
062  private volatile Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
063
064  private volatile Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
065
066
067  /*
068   * Constructors.
069   */
070
071
072  private JavaTypeSet(final Type type) {
073    this(JavaType.of(type));
074  }
075
076  private JavaTypeSet(final JavaType javaType) {
077    super();
078    this.set = Set.of(javaType);
079  }
080
081  private JavaTypeSet(final Collection<?> types) {
082    super();
083    final int size = types == null ? 0 : types.size();
084    if (size <= 0) {
085      this.set = Set.of();
086    } else if (size == 1) {
087      final Object o = types instanceof List<?> list ? list.get(0) : types.iterator().next();
088      if (o instanceof JavaType jt) {
089        this.set = Set.of(jt);
090      } else if (o instanceof Type t) {
091        this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of(t));
092      } else {
093        this.set = Set.of();
094      }
095    } else {
096      final Set<JavaType> set = new LinkedHashSet<>(8); // LinkedHashSet is critical for ordering
097      for (final Object type : types) {
098        if (type instanceof JavaType jt) {
099          set.add(jt);
100        } else if (type instanceof Type t) {
101          set.add(JavaType.of(t));
102        }
103      }
104      this.set = Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);
105    }
106  }
107
108
109  /*
110   * Instance methods.
111   */
112
113
114  /**
115   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
116   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
117   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
118   *
119   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
120   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
121   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}
122   *
123   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
124   *
125   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
126   *
127   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
128   * threads.
129   */
130  public final JavaTypeSet nonInterfaceTypes() {
131    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
132                              .filter(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType)
133                              .toList());
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
138   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
139   * JavaTypeSet}.
140   *
141   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
142   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
143   * JavaTypeSet}.
144   *
145   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
146   *
147   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
148   *
149   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
150   * threads.
151   */
152  public final JavaTypeSet interfaceTypes() {
153    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
154                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType)
155                           .toList());
156  }
157

164   *

166   *
167   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
168   *
169   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
170   * threads.
171   */
172  @Override // Set<Type>
173  public final boolean add(final Type type) {
174    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
175  }
176

188   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
189   * threads.

192  public final boolean addAll(final Collection<? extends Type> c) {
193    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
194  }

200   *
201   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
202   *
203   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
204   * threads.
205   */
206  @Override // Set<Type>
207  public final void clear() {
208    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
209  }

246    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
247  }

250   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
251   *

253   *

257   *

259   *
260   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
261   * threads.
262   */
263  @Override // Set<Type>
264  public final boolean retainAll(final Collection<?> c) {
265    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
270   * to represent the most specialized subclass drawn from the types
271   * in this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
272   *
273   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
274   * Integer Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link
275   * Object Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
276   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
277   * Integer Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then
278   * either {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String
279   * String.class} will be returned.</p>
280   *
281   * <p>In practice, most {@link JavaTypeSet}s in normal use
282   * contain classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
283   *
284   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
285   * to represent the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy
286   * drawn from the types in this {@link JavaTypeSet}; never {@code
287   * null}; the {@link Type} returned is guaranteed to be either a
288   * {@link Class} or a {@link java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
289   *
290   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
291   *
292   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
293   * certain cases.
294   *
295   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
296   * threads.
297   *
298   * @see #mostSpecializedInterfaceType()
299   */
300  public final Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType() {
301    Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
302    if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE) {
303      return null;
304    } else if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null) {
305      mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType);
306      this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null ? NullType.INSTANCE : mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
307    }
308    return mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
309  }
310
311  /**
312   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
313   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
314   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
315   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link JavaTypeSet}
316   * contains no interfaces.
317   *
318   * <p>The {@link Class} that is represented indirectly by the return
319   * value, if any, is guaranteed to return {@code true} from its
320   * {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
321   *
322   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
323   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link java.io.Closeable
324   * Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class},
325   * then this method will return {@link java.io.Closeable
326   * Closeable.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
327   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link AutoCloseable
328   * AutoCloseable.class} and {@link java.io.Serializable
329   * Serializable.class}, then either {@link AutoCloseable
330   * AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
331   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
332   *
333   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
334   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
335   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
336   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null}; the {@link Type} returned is
337   * guaranteed to be either a {@link Class} or a {@link
338   * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
339   *
340   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
341   *
342   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
343   * certain cases.
344   *
345   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
346   * threads.
347   *
348   * @see #mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType()
349   */
350  public final Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType() {
351    Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
352    if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE) {
353      return null;
354    } else if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null) {
355      mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType);
356      this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType = mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null ? NullType.INSTANCE : mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
357    }
358    return mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
359  }
360
361  private final Type mostSpecialized(final Predicate<? super Type> p) {
362    Type candidate = null;
363    for (final JavaType javaType : this.set) {
364      final Type type = javaType.object();
365      if (candidate == null) {
366        if (p.test(type)) {
367          candidate = type;
368        }
369      } else {
370        for (final Type supertype : JavaTypes.supertypes(type)) {
371          if (p.test(supertype) && this.set.contains(JavaType.of(supertype)) && JavaTypes.supertype(candidate, supertype)) {
372            candidate = supertype;
373          }
374        }
375      }
376    }
377    return candidate;
378  }
379
380  @Override // Set<Type>
381  public final boolean contains(final Object o) {
382    return o instanceof Type t && this.set.contains(JavaType.of(t));
383  }
384
385  @Override // Set<Type>
386  public final boolean isEmpty() {
387    return this.set.isEmpty();
388  }
389
390  @Override // Set<Type>
391  public final int size() {
392    return this.set.size();
393  }
394
395  @Override // Set<Type>
396  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
397    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
398      return Collections.emptyIterator();
399    } else {
400      return new TypeIterator(this.set.iterator());
401    }
402  }
403
404  @Override // Set<Type>
405  public final Stream<Type> stream() {
406    return this.set.stream().map(JavaType::object);
407  }
408
409  @Override // Set<Type>
410  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
411    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
412      return Spliterators.emptySpliterator();
413    } else {
414      return
415        Spliterators.spliterator(this.iterator(),
416                                 this.size(),
417                                 DISTINCT | IMMUTABLE | NONNULL | ORDERED | SIZED | SUBSIZED);
418    }
419  }
420
421  @Override // Object
422  public final int hashCode() {
423    return this.set.hashCode();
424  }
425
426  @Override // Object
427  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
428    if (other == this) {
429      return true;
430    } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
431      return this.set.equals(((JavaTypeSet)other).set);
432    } else {
433      return false;
434    }
435  }
436
437  @Override // Object
438  public final String toString() {
439    return this.set.toString();
440  }
441
442
443  /*
444   * Static methods.
445   */
446
447
448  /**
449   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
450   * supplied {@link Type}.
451   *
452   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code
453   * null}
454   *
455   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
456   * supplied {@link Type}; never {@code null}
457   *
458   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
459   *
460   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
461   *
462   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
463   *
464   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
465   * threads.
466   *
467   * @see #of(JavaType)
468   *
469   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
470   */
471  @Convenience
472  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t) {
473    return of(JavaType.of(t));
474  }
475
476  /**
477   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
478   * supplied {@link Type}s.
479   *
480   * @param t0 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
481   * {@code null}
482   *
483   * @param t1 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
484   * {@code null}
485   *
486   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
487   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
488   *
489   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
490   *
491   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
492   *
493   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
494   *
495   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
496   * threads.
497   *
498   * @see #of(Collection)
499   *
500   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
501   */
502  @Convenience
503  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t0, final Type t1) {
504    return of(List.of(JavaType.of(t0), JavaType.of(t1)));
505  }
506
507  /**
508   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
509   * {@link JavaType}.
510   *
511   * @param t the {@link JavaType} in question; must not be {@code
512   * null}
513   *
514   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
515   * {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
516   *
517   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
518   *
519   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
520   *
521   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
522   *
523   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
524   * threads.
525   */
526  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final JavaType t) {
527    return new JavaTypeSet(t);
528  }
529
530  /**
531   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the supplied
532   * {@link JavaType}s.
533   *
534   * @param t0 one of the {@link JavaType}s in question; must not be
535   * {@code null}
536   *
537   * @param t1 one of the {@link JavaType}s in question; must not be
538   * {@code null}
539   *
540   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
541   * supplied {@link JavaType}s; never {@code null}
542   *
543   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
544   *
545   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
546   *
547   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
548   *
549   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
550   * threads.
551   *
552   * @see #of(Collection)
553   */
554  @Convenience
555  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final JavaType t0, final JavaType t1) {
556    return of(List.of(t0, t1));
557  }
558
559  /**
560   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
561   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
562   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}.
563   *
564   * @param types the {@link Collection} in question; must not be
565   * {@code null}
566   *
567   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
568   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
569   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}; never {@code null}
570   *
571   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code types} is {@code null}
572   *
573   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
574   *
575   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
576   *
577   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
578   * threads.
579   */
580  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Collection<?> types) {
581    return new JavaTypeSet(types);
582  }
583
584  /**
585   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
586   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
587   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
588   * itself).
589   *
590   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
591   *
592   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
593   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
594   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
595   * itself)
596   *
597   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
598   *
599   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
600   *
601   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
602   *
603   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
604   * threads.
605   *
606   * @see #of(Collection)
607   *
608   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
609   */
610  @Convenience
611  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t) {
612    return of(JavaTypes.supertypes(t));
613  }
614
615  /**
616   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
617   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
618   * modeled by the supplied {@link JavaType} (which include the
619   * modeled {@link Type} itself).
620   *
621   * @param jt the {@link JavaType} in question; must not be {@code
622   * null}
623   *
624   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
625   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
626   * modeled by the supplied {@link JavaType} (which include the
627   * modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
628   *
629   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code jt} is {@code null}
630   *
631   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
632   *
633   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
634   *
635   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
636   * threads.
637   *
638   * @see #ofSupertypes(Type)
639   *
640   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
641   */
642  @Convenience
643  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final JavaType jt) {
644    return ofSupertypes(jt.type());
645  }
646
647  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final JavaType t) {
648    return nonInterfaceType(t.type());
649  }
650
651  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final Type t) {
652    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
653    return c != null && !c.isInterface();
654  }
655
656  private static final boolean interfaceType(final JavaType t) {
657    return interfaceType(t.type());
658  }
659
660  private static final boolean interfaceType(final Type t) {
661    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
662    return c != null && c.isInterface();
663  }
664
665
666  /*
667   * Inner and nested classes.
668   */
669
670
671  private static final class TypeIterator implements Iterator<Type> {
672
673    private final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i;
674
675    private TypeIterator(final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i) {
676      super();
677      this.i = i;
678    }
679
680    @Override // Iterator<Type>
681    public final boolean hasNext() {
682      return this.i.hasNext();
683    }
684
685    @Override // Iterator<Type>
686    public final Type next() {
687      return this.i.next().object();
688    }
689
690    @Override // Iterator<Type>
691    public final void remove() {
692      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
693    }
694
695  }
696
697
698  private static final class NullType implements Type {
699
700    private static final Type INSTANCE = new NullType();
701
702    private NullType() {
703      super();
704    }
705
706  }
707
708}
